channel.title: Comments on: A Quick Tour Of ES6 (Or, The Bits You’ll Actually Use)

item.title: By: Gwyn Evans
item.dc:creator: Gwyn Evans
item.description: Where you write "You can’t emit the brackets", I think you mean "omit"?
item.content:encoded: Where you write “You can’t emit the brackets”, I think you mean “omit”?

item.title: By: Marc Cornellà
item.dc:creator: Marc Cornellà
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/es6-the-bits-youll-actually-use/#comment-19363">Marc Cornellà</a>.
Same on the RaisedButton.jsx: https://github.com/jamesknelson/numbat-ui/blob/6d5e2f8dc347c51f2c268fede0725906babdf9f7/src/components/RaisedButton/RaisedButton.jsx#L53
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Marc Cornellà.

Same on the RaisedButton.jsx: https://github.com/jamesknelson/numbat-ui/blob/6d5e2f8dc347c51f2c268fede0725906babdf9f7/src/components/RaisedButton/RaisedButton.jsx#L53

item.title: By: Marc Cornellà
item.dc:creator: Marc Cornellà
item.description:
The snippet in the arrow functions is now found in SelectRipple.jsx#L82:
https://github.com/jamesknelson/numbat-ui/blob/c8c68996c4b2300b7e3a50ff0c69c16bef564b05/src/components/SelectRipple/SelectRipple.jsx#L82
A trick when linking to GitHub code: you can get the permalink to the current master commit by pressing 'Y', which will replace the 'master' in the URL to the actual commit hash.
Great post!
item.content:encoded:
The snippet in the arrow functions is now found in SelectRipple.jsx#L82:

https://github.com/jamesknelson/numbat-ui/blob/c8c68996c4b2300b7e3a50ff0c69c16bef564b05/src/components/SelectRipple/SelectRipple.jsx#L82

A trick when linking to GitHub code: you can get the permalink to the current master commit by pressing ‘Y’, which will replace the ‘master’ in the URL to the actual commit hash.

Great post!

item.title: By: Hans Schenker
item.dc:creator: Hans Schenker
item.description: Beautiful Design and valuable Content! Congratulations!!

item.title: By: jamesknelson

item.description:

Oops, well caught. Thanks.

item.title: By: Chad
item.dc:creator: Chad
item.description: Minor comment, your link to "Symbols" actually points to the MDN resource for "Maps"
item.content:encoded: Minor comment, your link to “Symbols” actually points to the MDN resource for “Maps”
